clinical_particulars.therapeutic_indications: For the management of the manifestations of psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia

contraindications.disease: LD sub 50 sub 65 mg kg Orally in mice
contraindications.pharmacodynamics: Loxapine a dibenzoxazepine compound represents a subclass of tricyclic antipsychotic agents chemically distinct from the thioxanthenes butyrophenones and phenothiazines Pharmacologically Loxapine is a tranquilizer for which the exact mode of action has not been established however it is believed that by antagonising dopamine and serotonin receptors there is a marked cortical inhibition which can manifest as tranquilization and suppression of aggression
